TextView.android:text: \tAs there is a significant risk of scalding or over-pressure, a SDHW system must be capable of hydraulic and electrical isolation from any pump and the pre-heat storage, to allow for periodic maintenance. The isolation mechanism, such as ball or gate valves, must not be able to accidentally isolate the collector from a route to safety devices. In particular, no valve must be placed so as to isolate a safety pressure release valve or expansion/drainback vessel. A solar primary system should include a clear and safe means of isolating a collector from the pre-heat store.
